intro.description: This type of analysis analyzes one specific catalog in a database. The result of the analysis gives information about the content of the catalog.

item.title: select a catalog to analyze
item.description: Note that catalog analysis is possible only with databases that include catalog entities in their physical structure. This step opens the Create New Analysis wizard. You can right click on the "Analysis" folder or on a catalog (or click the link below). This wizard helps you to fill the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description....). At the end it opens the corresponding editor in which you can define the settings of the analysis.

item.title: Review your settings
item.description: This step allows you to review and change your analysis settings, if necessary, in the open catalog editor.

item.title: Analyze
item.description: To execute the analysis, click on the "Run" button at the bottom of the editor (or click the link below). You can run the analysis with a context menu on the "Analysis" object in the "DQ Repository" view.
